h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Identifier for this element. Start ids with a letter. "ref" attributes in other elements may use this id value to "link" to this element.

h:attr-help.name: revision
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Revision status of this element. def-content will define which revisions are printed.

h:attr-help.name: revision-flag
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Describe difference of this element's content from a previous version. "deleted" will not print in non-draft output. This element is not consistently implemented for upper level elements.

h:attr-help.name: gmt
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Hour offset, for example PST would be: -08. Allowed values: -12...00..+11

h:attr-help.name: date
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Usually the Date keyword is put here. For example: $Date: 2009/03/29 05:11:49 $

h:attr-help.name: rev
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Usually the Revision keyword is put here. For example: $Revision: 1.2 $

h:attr-help.name: repository
h:attr-help.h:short-help: The directory path, after the "root" is put here. For example: sf/book2/src

h:attr-help.name: root
h:attr-help.h:short-help: The repository "root" is put here. For example: :ext:LOGNAME@moria.dynu.com:/data/public.cvs

h:attr-help.name: source
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Usually the Source keyword is put here. For example: $Source: /repo/local.cvs/app/story-xml/src/story5/help.xml,v $

h:attr-help.name: svn-path
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Usually the URL keyword is put here. For example: $URL$

h:element-help.h:short-help: A short description of the book. Use this to hold text that could be printed on the book's back cover. Or text that would be put in an on-line description of the book.
Address for this person or organization.
Organization or company name.
Information about the author. This is fir that that would be included in an optional "About the Author" section.
This groups one or more authors.
Describe the author.
Bold text.
Define a biliographic identifier. This will be printed on the copyright page.

h:attr-help.name: other-class
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Define the id class in the value.

h:element-help.h:short-help: This is the top element for the book.
Define information related to the book's publication.
Force a line break in a paragraph
Chapter preface. For single file output, this will print after Preface. For muli-file chapter output, this will print before the chapter.
Start a chapter.
Define information related to the chapter. This is usually only used when chapters are put in separate files or if they have different authors, from the book authors.
City name.
Describe the book's coauthor, if any.
This is just the top element.
Define copyright years and name of copyright holder.
Country name.
TheBase url part to prepend to url attr in def-img and def-link. (You'll want to make a base that is blank, for URLs that are absolute (not relative to a base.)

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: id to use in def-img or def-link

h:element-help.h:short-help: Define what content will be printed with this style. Use this to defined different views of the content, for alternate versions, drafts, or reviews.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: The id that would be used in def-style, to select this content.

h:attr-help.name: ch-refs
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print exactly this, space seperated, list of chapter ids. Overrides the revision selection, if non-blank.

h:attr-help.name: link-fmt
h:attr-help.h:short-help:
default - use the link tag's attr (if pdf, no 'a' tag)
full - force attr: img title, url, content (if pdf, no 'a' tag)
long - force attr: title, url, content (if pdf, no 'a' tag)
short - force attr: title, url (if pdf, no 'a' tag)
text - force attr: title, url (no 'a' tag)
plain - force attr: title (no 'a' tag)

h:attr-help.name: thread-refs
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Only print thread ids that are in this list.

h:attr-help.name: unit-refs
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print exactly this list of units (space seperated). Overrides other revision selections, for units.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Define what is printed in draft output. This options only affect draft output format. Just about all draft only text will be printed in the draft color. Default is 0 for missing attributes.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: id to be used in def-style

h:attr-help.name: thread-all
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print all threads, not just the threads defined in def-content.

h:attr-help.name: thread-all-vp
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print all viewpoints in threads. (I.e. all t elements)

h:attr-help.name: thread-id-vp
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print the who-ref ids with the text.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Define an image. The content of the element is the image's alt text.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Image id to be used in img or link elements.

h:attr-help.name: url
h:attr-help.h:short-help: URL for image (not including base part, if that is relevent).

h:element-help.h:short-help: Define a link. The content of the element is the link's title.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: id to be used in link elements.

h:attr-help.name: url
h:attr-help.h:short-help: URL for the link (not including the base part, if that is relevant).

h:attr-help.name: img-ref
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Optional image that may be defined in the link.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Default is 0 for missing attributes, unless noted otherwise.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: id to be used in def-style.

h:attr-help.name: auto-break
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Set to 1, to put a section break (a blank line) automatically between units.

h:attr-help.name: ch-title-size
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Chapter title font size. Also the subtitle font size on the title page.

h:attr-help.name: ch-page-break
h:attr-help.h:short-help:
Controls page breaks for chapters. TOC always starts on odd page.
none - ch-preface, preface and first chapter start on a new page.
some-odd - ch-preface, preface first chapter, and epilog start on odd pages. Other chapters break on any page.
all-odd - same as some-odd, but all chapters start on odd pages.

h:attr-help.name: draft
h:attr-help.h:short-help: HTML only: draft text color, i.e. text that will not print in final drafts.

h:attr-help.name: gutter
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print only: space for binding (inside edge).

h:attr-help.name: head-align
h:attr-help.h:short-help:
Print only: Heading aligment:
page no. is aways on outside edge, if there is other text. If just page-no head-type, then head-align applies to the page-no.
left - align non-page text to inside edge
right - align non-page text to outside edge
center - center the text

h:attr-help.name: head-location
h:attr-help.h:short-help:
Print only: Heading location.
top - top of page, with a rule line below
bottom - bottom of page, with a rule line above

h:attr-help.name: head-type
h:attr-help.h:short-help:
Print only: Heading type:
page-no - only page numbers
title - numbers outside, title inside
author-title - numbers outside, author even, title odd
title-chapter - numbers outside, title even, chapter odd

h:attr-help.name: line-height
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Line height percent. Recommend 120 for single space, 240 for double spacing.

h:attr-help.name: margin
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print only: top, bottom, left, and right margins. (specify, in or cm)

h:attr-help.name: multi-file
h:attr-help.h:short-help: HTML only: If 1, print each chapter in separate files. If 0, print whole book all in one file.

h:attr-help.name: next-prev
h:attr-help.h:short-help: HTML only: for multi-file output, include next/previous links?

h:attr-help.name: output-type
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Define the output file type. The selected print template may override this option.

h:attr-help.name: page
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print only: final page size, in inches

h:element-help.h:short-help: Define a number of different output styles, selecting from different def-content, def-draft, and def-print settings.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Identifier for this element. This is used in style-info element. Start ids with a letter.

h:attr-help.name: debug
h:attr-help.h:short-help: If 1, then debug messages are output.

h:attr-help.name: draft
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Depreciated. The print template overrides this.

h:element-help.h:short-help: The content describes a plot thread.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Identifyer for this element. This is used in thread.ref.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Define the default when time. Any missing values in start-date will be filled with one of these values.
Describe a location for scenes and sequels units. A when element in the unit can define diffrences from this description.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Identifier for this element. Used by when.ref.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Describe a character in the story. A narrator character would also be created for non-first person stories. A who element in the unit can define difference from this description.

h:attr-help.name: id
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Identifier for this unit. Used by who.ref.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Outline description for this unit.
Give more detail about this unit time.
Book edition number.
Editor information.
Email address for person or publisher.
What time does the unit end. If attr are missing from end-date, get them from start-date.
Epilog text.
FAX phone number.
File prefix put before chapter file names. Only used with multi-file output.
First name
Copyright holder name (usually one of the listed authors or publisher)
Mr, Ms, Mrs, Dr. etc.
Italic text
Print an inline image.
Keywords for the book. May be printed on copyright page. Content will be output in HTML meta-keywods element.
This text will be printed at end of the copyright page.
Jr, II, III, etc.
Output an inline link. I.e. a link to another file or a web page.

h:attr-help.name: img
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Display any image defined for this link.

h:attr-help.name: title
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Link text. If this is empty, then the def-link content will be used.

h:attr-help.name: url
h:attr-help.h:short-help: Print the link's URL in the output (in parens).

h:element-help.h:short-help: HTML only: Text for HTML meta-description.
Additional address information.
Other names for this person.
Describe outline information about this unit. This will only print in the draft output.
Regular paragraph text, for use in threads. Use this when s or t elements don't make sense. Formated as indented paragraphs.
Regular paragraph text used in non-thread sections. Usually this formats as block paragraphs.
Phone number. Include international digits if not U.S.
Post Office Box number.
Postal code. In the U.S.: zip code
This text is put just after the chapter title and just before the first unit thread text is printed. A small rule is used as a separator.
Preformatted text. This uses a fixed space font. Line breaks and leading space characters will be preserved. This is used in thread elments.
Preformatted text. This uses a fixed space font. Line breaks and leading space characters will be preserved. This is used in non-thread elments.
Preface text.
This text is put just after the last unit thread, at the end of the chapter. A small rule is used as a separator.
Publication date.
Publisher information.
Publisher's full name.
Define a block quote. Text is indented at margins an a blank line is put before and after the text. Use pre or br to preserve line breaks.
Define version control information.
Use this to define revisions within paragraph. The revision-flag is required. deleted text will not be printed.
Say text. The who-ref may be defined for draft output, but it has no other affect on the output. Formatted as indented paragraph.
What date/time does the unit begin. If attr are missing from start-date, use def-when.
State or providence name.
Define the DTD version for this story. One or more error messages will be printed if this does not match correct story template version.
Define elements related to the story content. These are elements that are helpful to writing the story. None of this will print in final copy.
One or more street address lines.
Define which def-style is used to format the book. This may be overridden with a command line option.

h:attr-help.name: thread-refs
h:attr-help.h:short-help: A thread id. This defines the threads that will be displayed in the editor view, which may be different from the def-content threads selected in a style.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Additional title text.
Also know as a person's last name.
Thought text, by one of the characters. The thread's who-refs defines which t elements will print. Formatted as indented paragraph.

h:attr-help.name: who-ref
h:attr-help.h:short-help: The def-who id of the character who thought this. Also known as the viewpoint character.

h:element-help.h:short-help: This is a container for different story threads or sub-plots. The ref id defines which thread the text belongs to. Using def-content.thread-refs, you can output single threads, to look for inconsistencies. This can also be used to define alternate story threads, which might be put in the final version.

h:attr-help.name: who-refs
h:attr-help.h:short-help: One or more def-who ids. More that one is allowed, so that a narrator can be included, along with mixed viewpoints.

h:element-help.h:short-help: Title text for the parent element
Abbreviated title text which may be used in a page header
Typewriter text. Fixed space text.
Main container for a scene or sequel.
Define when this unit takes place.
Define the main location for this unit.
Define one or more characters who are in this unit.
Copyright year. Define one or more.
